data.title: Lunchlecture jan jarab
data.text:
Kindly Invite You to a Lunch Lecture:

The UN and the EU in Human Rights:

An Ever Closer Partnership?

by Mr. Jan Jarab

Regional Representative for Europe

of the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights

Wednesday 18 March 2015, 12.00-14.00

United Nations Regional Information Centre (UNRIC)

Nadia Younes Room, 8th floor, block C2,

Wetstraat 155, Brussels

Participation is free, but we kindly ask you to confirm your

attendance before 16 March at conference@ggs.kuleuven.be

Short Biography

Jan Jařab has been the Regional Representative for Europe of the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights since January 2010. The Regional Office for Europe deals with the human rights dimension of internal and external EU policies as well as with human rights challenges in EU Member States and Candidate Countries.

Previously, Jan Jařab served as Member of Cabinet of Vladimír Špidla, European Commissioner for Employment, Social Affairs and Equal Opportunities (2004-2010).

For almost four years (2001-2004) he served the Government of the Czech Republic as its Commissioner for Human Rights and Director of the Human Rights Division of the Office of Government. Before that, he worked for the Human Rights Division for two years (1991-2001) as Secretary of Section on Civil and Political Rights and Section on Racial Discrimination.

Jan Jařab holds a doctorate in medicine from Prague's Charles University and a MSc in anthropology from University College London.

This lecture will be chaired by Professor Jan Wouters (KU Leuven).

In cooperation with:
